acts.title: The Ash of the Lily
acts.description: This act captures the suffocating atmosphere of a Paris under siege, where the Troy Cycle manifests in the internal rot and external pressure of a city devouring its own. It establishes the brutal stakes of the religious conflict, forcing Elouan de Vassy to choose between survival and a desperate gamble for peace.

scenes.purpose: Elouan de Vassy witnesses a public execution ordered by 'The Sixteen,' establishing the lethal paranoia of Paris and his own precarious position as a secret moderate.
Marquise Genevieve d'Aubigné summons Elouan de Vassy to a hidden cellar, entrusting him with the secret passage maps and the mission to reach Henri of Navarre's camp.
Father Bastien Thorne leads a raid on Elouan de Vassy’s quarters, narrowly missing the courier but discovering evidence of Genevieve d'Aubigné’s 'Politique' network.
Elouan de Vassy attempts to scale the barricades during a Spanish bombardment, barely escaping the city while Father Bastien Thorne watches from the ramparts, marking him for death.

acts.title: The Pilgrimage of Steel
acts.description: Embodying the Search Cycle, this act follows the arduous journey across a landscape of 'Decaying Renaissance' in pursuit of the stolen sword, Joyeuse. The quest shifts from a simple delivery to a spiritual and political search for the soul of France amidst the ruins of the Loire Valley.

scenes.purpose: Elouan de Vassy meets Marquise Genevieve d'Aubigné at a scarred chateau to learn that the message is useless without the recovery of the stolen sword, Joyeuse.
Elouan de Vassy tracks the relic to a desecrated abbey, where he must outmaneuver Father Bastien Thorne’s 'Red Capes' in a tense game of cat-and-mouse through the cloisters.
Father Bastien Thorne captures and interrogates Elouan de Vassy, attempting to break his faith in the 'heretic' King before Marquise Genevieve d'Aubigné orchestrates a daring distraction.
Elouan de Vassy recovers Joyeuse from a Spanish detachment and finally reaches Henri’s camp, presenting both the maps and the relic to the Bearnais king.

acts.title: The Altar of the Seine
acts.description: The Return Cycle brings the narrative back to the gates of Paris for the restoration of the monarchy and the recognition of a new order. It focuses on the 'necessary' conversion and the final confrontation at the heart of the kingdom to heal the fractured mosaic of France.

scenes.purpose: Marquise Genevieve d'Aubigné smuggles Elouan de Vassy back into Paris to coordinate with moderate factions as Henri prepares his public conversion to Catholicism.
Father Bastien Thorne, realizing the League is losing its grip, plots to assassinate Henri during the Te Deum, forcing Elouan de Vassy into a race through the city's catacombs.
Elouan de Vassy confronts Father Bastien Thorne in the rafters of the cathedral, preventing the assassination and forcing the priest to face the reality of his own fanaticism.
As Henri enters the city to the cry of 'Paris is worth a Mass,' Elouan de Vassy and Marquise Genevieve d'Aubigné watch from the shadows, acknowledging the high cost of their restored peace.
